title: 140 Funny, Sarcastic & Clever WiFi Network Name Ideas

steps.title: Make your guests laugh when they connect to your WiFi.
steps.content: Make your guests laugh when they connect to your WiFi. There’s no reason your network name needs to be a bunch of boring letters and numbers—choose something more personal. Funny WiFi names are becoming more and more common, and they’ll usually get a chuckle out of anyone who sees them (whether they're at your apartment or down the hall). Here are some popular examples: [1] X Research source No More Mr. WiFi My WiFi Is Always Right Router? I Hardly Know Her! Keep It On the Download It Burns When IP The Password Is… Open Sesame Wi Believe I Can Fi Wi-Finders Keepers No Laughing Router Just One Byte Nacho WiFi Theodore Routervelt You Click, I Pay 404 Network Unavailable No, This Is Not Yours Extremely Slow WiFi You Don’t Want to Use Hit the Road Jack Input The Promised LAN Wi-Fight Club

steps.title: Make a witty pun with WiFi-related terms.
steps.content: Make a witty pun with WiFi-related terms. One of the easiest ways to make a funny WiFi network name is to use puns . Think of different ways you can incorporate words like WiFi, network, router, data, and other Internet terms. Here are some examples: [2] X Research source Ask Me Out on a Data That’s What She SSID Lag Out Loud MothersMaidenName New England Clam Router IP Steady Streams Feeling Routy WiMCA Wi-Find You Cute Putting in the Network Hopping on the Bandwidth Who What When Where WiFi Benjamin FrankLAN Wi Fi Fo Fum Vladimir Computin One if by LAN… Since 1997 The LAN Before Time Bilbo Laggins LAN Halen

steps.title: Troll your neighbors with a sarcastic name.
steps.content: Troll your neighbors with a sarcastic name. Choose a name that gives a little attitude and discourages strangers from trying to use your WiFi for free. Let them know how slow the connection is, include a fake password, or directly tell them to get their own WiFi. Everyone else will probably think it’s hilarious! Here are some examples: [3] X Research source Very Slow WiFi Click Here for Viruses Searching… I Heard the Neighbor’s WiFi is Better Close Your Bathroom Curtains No Internet Access You Won’t Get Hacked Here Help, I’m Trapped in This Router My Password is 1234 Byte Me Gone Phishing Will Exchange Food for Password Get Off My LAN FBI Surveillance Van Stop Being a Mooch Hey, Get Your Own WiFi Mom, Click This One Unregistered Hypercam 2 Witness Protection Password is Gullible

steps.title: Show off your geeky side with your WiFi name.
steps.content: Show off your geeky side with your WiFi name. If you’re a proud nerd who loves franchises like Harry Potter , Star Wars , and Game of Thrones , you’re in luck! There are a ton of fun, punny ways to incorporate your favorite series into your network name. Here are some examples: [4] X Research source The Force Hogwarts A LANister Never Forgets Inigo the Modem Winternet is Coming (Hogwarts House) Common Room WiFi Jar Jar Linksys Yer a WiFi Harry LAN Solo Lord Voldemodem Darth Router You Shall Not Password Live Long and Router Friendly Neighborhood Spider-LAN Sync My Battleship Yoda Only Connection I Need Dungeon Masters Only Dunder Mifflin Accio Internet Connecto Patronum

steps.title: Reference your favorite songs, movies, or celebrities.
steps.content: Reference your favorite songs, movies, or celebrities. There are a ton of puns you can make that combine WiFi and your favorite pop culture references, and they’re sure to make your friends and family laugh when they see your network name. Think of some of your favorite movies, songs, or TV shows and see if there’s a way to reference the internet in the name. Here are some examples: [5] X Research source Panic! At the Cisco Wi-Fi Ms. American Pie 99 Problems but Wi-Fi Ain’t One Wu-Tang LAN We Didn’t Start the Firewall Silence of the LANS Pretty Fly for a WiFi I Can’t WiFi This Feeling Anymore Go Go Router Rangers Bill Wi the Science Fi Routers of the Lost Ark Lord of the Pings Where the Wild Pings Are Networking 9 to 5 Alice in WonderLAN Luke I Am Your WiFi Linksys WiFi Chance the Router Winona Router Drop It Like It’s Hotspot

steps.title: Pick a name that’s funny and cool.
steps.content: Pick a name that’s funny and cool. If you want a WiFi name that’s a little less silly, there are still a ton of great options. Try to think of some ways to incorporate WiFi-related terms without making an actual joke. Here are some cool examples: Titanic Syncing I’m With the Bandwidth Smooth as Buffer Hide Yo Kids, Hide Yo WiFi Wi-Fight the Inevitable? No LAN for the Wicked Another Brick in the Firewall I’m Feeling a Connection Say It Router Reservation Required Nothing but Net When in Roam All Systems Go Down to the Wire Life in the Fast LANe Load ‘Em and Modem Smooth LANding The Web of Lies Winter WonderLAN Look Ma, No Wires

steps.title: Come up with a WiFi name not many people have.
steps.content: Come up with a WiFi name not many people have. While it may be hard to come up with a funny WiFi name that no one else has, there are some options that aren’t as common. If you’re tired of seeing names like “FBI Surveillance Van” or “Nacho WiFi,” here are some names to consider: Do Re Mi Fa So La Wi Fi Tell My WiFi Love Her AA Meeting Wi of the Figer Slower Than Yo Momma Saved a Bunch of Money by Switching to GEICO It’s a Small World WiFi Internet WiFi Art Thou Romeo Leaky Sync IP Frequently We’ve Been Trying to Reach You About Your Car’s Extended Warranty Wi Oh Wi Feed Me If You Can’t Beat ‘Em, Modem I’m Under Your Bed I Don’t Miss Dial Up The LAN of the Free LAN Down Under Wi Not? Thou Shalt Not Covet Thy Neighbor’s WiFi

steps.title: Don’t reveal any personal information in your WiFi name.
steps.content: Don’t reveal any personal information in your WiFi name. Anyone can see your WiFi name when they’re trying to connect to a network, so it isn’t a good idea to include sensitive information in your name. Avoid using things like your address, birthday, or phone number to protect yourself from potential hackers. [6] X Research source Avoid using any of your common passwords in your WiFi name as well, and choose a password that’s hard to guess to connect to your network.

steps.title: Access your router settings.
steps.content: Access your router settings. The process of changing your WiFi name may vary slightly depending on which network you use. In general, connect to your WiFi and enter the default gateway address in the address bar of a web browser. Log in with your router password and other credentials. Usually, your gateway address will be something like 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1. If you haven’t changed your router credentials, check the router manual for login details. It’s also possible to change your WiFi name from your phone.

steps.title: Go to your wireless settings and change your WiFi name.
steps.content: Go to your wireless settings and change your WiFi name. Depending on your router, this may be labeled something like “Wireless” or “WiFi.” Once there, find the network name (SSID) field, delete the existing name, and enter your new one. In general, your new name must be under 32 characters. Avoid using special characters that may cause connection issues.

steps.title: Save your changes and reconnect your devices.
steps.content: Save your changes and reconnect your devices. Hit the “Save” or “Apply” button to save your new network name. After this, your WiFi will temporarily disconnect, so be sure to reconnect all your devices using the new WiFi name.
